Are you an economics PhD student within 1-2 years of graduation interested in #macroeconomics and policy work impacting the #globaleconomy? 

Apply Now for the Fund Internship Program for a 10-12 week internship this summer. Closing date: Feb 15
https://t.co/ecSDRMRkr0 https://t.co/UGhxNnbAXh
🗓️ Tune in for a conversation with @GitaGopinath at @AUC_Business on the outlook for the global economy.  Feb. 10 at 9:00am ET https://t.co/vlONw0s5Bq

A recovery is expected in 2021 in Latin America and the Caribbean, but risks remain. 

Read our latest #IMFBlog: https://t.co/3GBHRnpi3J #IMFAmericas https://t.co/E7KK1nqmii

Latin America and Caribbean’s Winding Road to Recovery. https://t.co/LJqHvAvMCe
#IMFAmericas #IMFblog https://t.co/TB1yFBNfFY

Join us LIVE NOW: Alejandro Werner, Director of IMF’s Western Hemisphere Department, discusses Latin America’s 2021 economic outlook: https://t.co/am36NNPRCQ
#IMFAmericas

Nigeria’s economy has been hit hard by the pandemic, the sharp drop in oil prices, and capital leaving the country. Here are 4 recommendations from our annual review of the Nigerian economy. https://t.co/2JFHndwC9k #IMFAfrica https://t.co/MYkxgkb2tC

The Nigerian economy is at a critical juncture as it grapples with problems including the COVID-19 pandemic. More in our annual review of the country’s economy: https://t.co/7To7hmomaH #IMFAfrica https://t.co/Imh7V2NBTu

#Telework is the new face of #inequality. How is this disruption being felt within and across countries? Read more in the latest IMF Research Perspectives: https://t.co/dQ9nvl1FYs #COVID19 https://t.co/Mwzuj3qvsE
What does history tell us about #pandemics and social unrest? Read our #IMFBlog https://t.co/9JgizydJ8R https://t.co/dCp6OY4GLB

The burden of the crisis has fallen unevenly across groups and has increased inequality. Workers with less education, youth, women, and those informally employed have suffered disproportionate income losses – says @GitaGopinath in her latest #IMFblog. #WEO https://t.co/CljmxZH5bU https://t.co/UUTDwwSgEC

The January 2021 #FiscalMonitor highlights 5 priorities to enable a green, digital, and inclusive economy.

Learn more on our #IMFblog https://t.co/mEhAkJEXIU
#COVID19 https://t.co/DcBjMJpiyc

We project global growth of 5.5% for 2021 but much depends on the outcome of the race between the virus and vaccines and on the policy support provided. Read @GitaGopinath’s latest #IMFblog. #WEO https://t.co/l6a6MLEYha https://t.co/B54w8YvfMW

Financial stability risks have been in check so far, but policymakers need to tackle the weaknesses exposed by the pandemic. What are they? Find out here https://t.co/Fvpbn6PLAO #GFSR #IMFBlog https://t.co/JU0BEd1iDx
What countries stand to gain most from #AI #robots? @imf_podcast https://t.co/un7MUz8Vul https://t.co/HRmAQ9Xx52

The strength of recovery varies across countries. Growth will hinge on the severity of the health crisis, the extent of lockdowns & disruptions to activity, cross-border spillovers, and the effectiveness of policy support to limit persistent damage. #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/53PiDBmWth
Have #lockdowns been unjustly blamed for slowing growth? Read more in the latest issue of IMF Research Perspectives https://t.co/dQ9nvl1FYs #COVID19 https://t.co/K9CnnJcfNQ

As the world emerges from the #COVID19 crisis, the global economy is at a critical juncture. The recovery will be shaped by whichever is faster: the virus or the vaccines. Watch the #WEO video. https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/lkSeaQM6xf

Our latest #GFSR research shows that foreign investment has provided #EmergingMarkets with more financing options thanks to optimistic market sentiment. Read more: https://t.co/lmHjwfJaFB #IMFBlog https://t.co/azJC0PLMgG

Before the pandemic, the IMF projected global public debt to be 84% of GDP at the end of 2020; it has now reached 98% of GDP.
 
Vitor Gaspar, the IMF’s Director of Fiscal Affairs, elaborates in our #IMFblog https://t.co/dlLjmi0E06 https://t.co/XkCU9TTlxv

DMD Antoinette M. Sayeh at #WES2021: “2021 can be the most consequential year of our lifetimes. If we can come together and sow the right policy seeds today, we can exit the crisis with minimal scarring and build the foundation of a 21st century economy.” https://t.co/JwjJY6BLtv https://t.co/0H1Y7fb2Dq

How do vaccine plans in the  #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica and #CentralAsia affect the economic outlook?

Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh will deliver a keynote address on global economic outlook and policy priorities at #WES2021 Saturday, February 6 at 11:30am ET/16:30 UTC https://t.co/PUPshmJBxb @economicssummit

We often hear economists refer to “the informal economy.”  Learn what the term means—and why having fewer workers outside the formal economy can support sustainable development—in #FandD’s latest #BacktoBasics article: https://t.co/NTL8PjvUcR https://t.co/LaprhdS5FV

In today's IMF #WeekendRead we focus on the recovery prospects for the #MiddleEast & #CentralAsia, the social repercussions of pandemics, financial innovation and rising inequality, the impact of the pandemic on youth and their job opportunities, and more. https://t.co/2BKy72DIZ0 https://t.co/9fu0t0olTD
Recent IMF staff research finds that unrest and geographical mobility have declined during the #COVID19 pandemic #IMFBlog https://t.co/9JgizydJ8R https://t.co/OLQqkGjWwT

International and regional cooperation in the  #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica and #CentralAsia are essential to ensure equitable access to vaccines, address the pandemic, and support economic recovery. Read #IMFblog https://t.co/caYChE5fe1 https://t.co/NGAqiCS5mI
Recent IMF staff research finds that countries with more frequent and severe #epidemics also experienced greater unrest on average https://t.co/9JgizydJ8R #IMFBlog #COVID19 https://t.co/YwTwjngVrZ
Read #IMFblog https://t.co/caYChEmQ5z https://t.co/rM0PIt41h6
Will access to the COVID-19 vaccine play a critical role in the recovery?

Recovery in the #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica & #CentralAsia depends on 4 key aspects:
✔️ The extent of containment measures
✔️ Access to & distribution of vaccines
✔️ The scope of policies to support recovery
✔️ Global recovery & oil market dvlpmts
#IMFblog https://t.co/caYChE5fe1 https://t.co/r4EIR1q112

As #Morocco recovers from dual shocks, COVID-19 and severe drought, this video charts a path to recovery through health care coverage expansion, education reforms, anti-corruption measures, and fiscal policy that strengthens public finances. Global financial stability risks have been in check so far, but policy support remains crucial to the market rally and the economic recovery until vaccines become widely available. https://t.co/eceYbanDiA  #GFSR #IMFBlog

Financial markets look to be in good shape, but economic recovery is lagging. Some industry analysts say if investors reassess the economic outlook or doubt the effects of the policies to support the recovery, markets will fall. #GFSR

Do you think markets are headed for a fall?

STARTING NOW: A conversation on the latest update of the Global Financial Stability Report with IMF’s Adrian and Natalucci and @WSJ’s @greg_ip. Read the report: https://t.co/38YwyzpAlV #GFSR https://t.co/jx91frEMKx

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath shares the key findings on the latest World Economic Outlook, the biggest risks facing the world, and recommendations for policymakers. Read more in the latest #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/sodRYccGaX

The burden of the crisis has fallen unevenly across groups and has increased inequality. Workers with less education, youth, women, and those informally employed have suffered disproportionate income losses – says @GitaGopinath in her latest #IMFblog. #WEO https://t.co/CljmxZH5bU https://t.co/51roVC63xP

The strength of recovery varies across countries. Growth will hinge on the severity of the health crisis, the extent of lockdowns & disruptions to activity, cross-border spillovers, and the effectiveness of policy support to limit persistent damage. #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/NXAg9QcepR

The projected output loss for #AdvancedEconomies compared with the pre-COVID forecast is relatively smaller than for other countries, reflecting the strong policy support and the anticipated widespread availability of vaccines in summer 2021. Read the #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/1FL7pnUOPa

As the world emerges from the #COVID19 crisis, the global economy is at a critical juncture. The recovery will be shaped by whichever is faster: the virus or the vaccines. Watch the #WEO video. https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/eBtH1BtVM3

Emerging market & developing economies are projected to take diverging recovery paths. Economic structure, pre-crisis growth trends, the severity of the pandemic, and the size of their policy responses will shape their recovery profiles. #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/Kzp9ylIBkv

In our latest World Economic Outlook, we project global growth of 5.5% for 2021 but much depends on the outcome of the race between the virus and vaccines, and on the policy support provided. Read @GitaGopinath’s latest #IMFblog. #WEO https://t.co/l6a6MLEYha https://t.co/1ey1gvSSrl

The global economy is projected to grow 5.5% in 2021, a slight upward revision from the previous forecast, reflecting expectations of a vaccine-powered strengthening of activity later in the year and additional policy support in a few large economies. #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/uO2urvDQUB
REPLAY: Press Briefing – World Economic Outlook Update, January 2021. https://t.co/yIs7h1oUfs #WEO https://t.co/JYjLudKHa1

Beyond addressing issues arising directly from the pandemic, close international cooperation is needed to redouble climate change mitigation efforts, resolve underlying trade & technology tensions, and address gaps in the multilateral trading system. #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/6Rj7GQsyja

Chief Economist @GitaGopinath shares the key findings of the latest World Economic Outlook, the biggest risks facing the world now, and recommendations for policymakers . #WEO https://t.co/yIs7h1GvE2 https://t.co/fkseBBVZ8H

The projected output loss for #AdvancedEconomies compared with the pre-COVID forecast is relatively smaller than for other countries, reflecting the strong policy support and the anticipated widespread availability of vaccines in summer 2021.
